FuncDef:
The bgp path-attribute command configures the processing mode of the specified incorrect path attribute.
The undo bgp path-attribute command restores the default configuration. The bgp path-attribute command configures the processing mode of the specified incorrect path attribute. The undo bgp path-attribute command restores the default configuration. By default, path attribute messages are processed according to the standard protocol.


If the value of the Originator_ID attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn. If the value of the Originator_ID attribute in the Attr_Set attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn.


If the length of the Community, Ext-community, IPv6 ext-community, Large-community, Wide-community or Cluster_List attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn. If the length of the Community, Ext-community, IPv6 ext-community, Large-community, Wide-community or Cluster_List sub-attribute in the Attr_Set attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn. By default, path attribute messages are processed according to the standard protocol. If the value of the Originator_ID attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn. If the value of the Originator_ID attribute in the Attr_Set attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn. If the length of the Community, Ext-community, IPv6 ext-community, Large-community, Wide-community or Cluster_List attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn. If the length of the Community, Ext-community, IPv6 ext-community, Large-community, Wide-community or Cluster_List sub-attribute in the Attr_Set attribute is 0, the route corresponding to the attribute is withdrawn.
CLIs: undo bgp path-attribute { originator-id | attr-set } accept-zero-value
bgp path-attribute { community | ext-community | ipv6-ext-community | large-community | attr-set | wide-community | cluster-list } accept-zero-length
undo bgp path-attribute { community | ext-community | ipv6-ext-community | large-community | attr-set | wide-community | cluster-list } accept-zero-length
bgp path-attribute { community | ext-community | large-community | attr-set | wide-community | cluster-list } accept-zero-length
undo bgp path-attribute { community | ext-community | large-community | attr-set | wide-community | cluster-list } accept-zero-length

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates to accept the path attributes with a value of 0.
-

Indicates the IPv6-ext-community attribute.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

Indicates to accept zero-length path attributes.
-

ExtraInfo: If the local device receives an Update message with an incorrect format (containing a path attribute with a length of 0 or a value of 0), BGP session flapping may occur.
